news.title: TREE PLANTING 2025
news.summary: Watch as we take a step towards a greener future!
news.content:
Tree planting stands as more than a straightforward environmental act; it is a promise to safeguard our planet for future generations. In 2025, NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. embarked on a pioneering tree planting project that underscores our dedication to ecological stewardship. By aligning our corporate goals with environmental responsibility, we highlight the importance of restoring habitats, reinforcing biodiversity, and educating communities about sustainable practices.

At the heart of this effort, NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. planted 1,000 Nara seedlings in cooperation with the Department of Environment and Natural Resources–Community Environment and Natural Resources Office (DENR–CENRO) Guiguinto, Bulacan, under PPA Administrative Order No. 14-2020. This achievement exemplifies our commitment to preserving local ecosystems. By selecting the Nara tree—celebrated for its resilience and ecological value—we aimed not only to enhance biodiversity but also to foster long-term environmental health for surrounding communities.

Table of Contents

  • The Event: A Detailed Look
  • Environmental Impact and Future Prospects
  • A Long-Term Commitment

The Event: A Detailed Look

Held on March 15, 2025, the initiative took place at Ipo Dam, Mt. Balagbag, Montalban, Rizal, an area cherished for its panoramic vistas and ecological significance. This site was carefully chosen to maximize environmental benefits while inspiring participants with the region’s natural splendor. Volunteers, local advocates, and community members all converged to make the event a success. Guided by the principle that collective action can yield powerful results, the day’s activities were meticulously planned to give each seedling the best chance of survival.

The event was a model of collaboration. Assigning volunteers to tasks—such as soil preparation, planting, and aftercare—created a seamless operation that underscored the power of teamwork. The presence of local environmental advocates added valuable insights on the optimal ways to plant, nurture, and protect the seedlings. This harmony between corporate vision and grassroots engagement proved that diverse groups can unite under one objective: restoring nature’s balance.

Environmental Impact and Future Prospects

The significance of this initiative goes beyond a single day of planting. Each Nara seedling represents a tangible investment in cleaner air, greater biodiversity, and healthier ecosystems. Trees play a crucial role in sequestering carbon, a major factor in fighting climate change. By systematically planting Nara seedlings, we aim to reduce our carbon footprint while inspiring others to follow suit. Over time, these trees will form habitats that support various wildlife species, contributing to the vibrancy of local ecosystems and promoting ecological harmony.

Moreover, the event served as an educational platform. Recognizing that true change grows from community involvement, NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. invited local schools and organizations to participate. Through on-site workshops, participants gained deeper insights into how tree planting ties into wider ecological cycles, including water filtration, soil erosion control, and climate stabilization. This holistic approach fosters lasting passion for environmental care, ensuring that the knowledge planted during this event continues to flourish for many years to come.

A Long-Term Commitment

From our perspective, this tree planting activity marks a key milestone in an ongoing environmental program. NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. views sustainability as a continuous process rather than a one-time effort. Future endeavors will build on the momentum generated here, refining reforestation and habitat preservation methods while extending outreach to broader communities. We are also committed to monitoring these Nara seedlings in the coming years, collaborating with local stakeholders to assess their growth and well-being. Long-term engagement is vital to ensuring that these trees mature into robust pillars of the ecosystem, serving as habitats for wildlife and natural barriers against environmental threats.

In essence, the 2025 tree planting project captures our broader mission: to merge corporate responsibility with positive environmental actions. By involving employees, community members, and environmental experts, we have laid the groundwork for a lasting legacy of ecological stewardship. Our belief is that a healthy planet underpins both thriving communities and successful enterprises. Through collective effort and shared knowledge, NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. strives to safeguard the natural wonders of places like Ipo Dam for generations to come. Each tree planted stands as a meaningful step forward in protecting our planet’s future and inspiring others to join the cause, fostering a culture of environmental responsibility that resonates well beyond this single initiative. ​

In addition to our commitment to tree planting, NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. implements various corporate social responsibility initiatives. Learn more about Naess Cares and discover how we strive for sustainable and community-focused growth.
news.author: Marketing Team

news.title: PMMA ALUMNI HOMECOMING 2025
news.summary: NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. at the PMMA Alumni Homecoming 2025...
news.content: NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. at the PMMA Alumni Homecoming 2025 – attended by Operations Manager, Robinson Mandalones. Business Development Associate, Catrin Nombres and Recruitment Processor, Candie Salazar.
news.author: Finance Department

news.title: FLU VACCINE ACTIVITY
news.summary: NAESS crew and its employees actively participated in the Joint Flu Vaccination Activity at...
news.content: NAESS crew and its employees actively participated in the Joint Flu Vaccination Activity at the Dr. Mario S. Oca Memorial Hall, AMOSUP Seamen’s Hospital-Manila. A unified effort to promote wellness and protect the workforce—ensuring a healthier and safer future for all!
news.author: IT Department

news.title: Safety and Fire Drill Seminar 2025
news.summary: NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. proudly conducted the Safety and Fire Drill Seminar 2025, in collaboration with the Bureau of Fire Protection Manila Fire District - Paco Fire Sub Station.
news.content: NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. proudly conducted the Safety and Fire Drill Seminar 2025, in collaboration with the Bureau of Fire Protection Manila Fire District - Paco Fire Sub Station. This essential seminar aimed to enhance awareness and preparedness in emergency situations, equipping participants with critical knowledge and skills to respond effectively in the event of a fire or safety-related crisis. Through a series of informative sessions and practical drills, attendees were taught life-saving techniques, safety protocols, and the importance of teamwork during an emergency. By fostering a culture of safety and readiness, NAESS Shipping Philippines Inc. continues to prioritize the well-being of its employees and the community, ensuring that everyone is equipped to act swiftly and confidently in times of need.
news.author: IT Department

news.title: Shipboard Familiarization for NAESS Cadets
news.summary: Providing hands-on learning experience, allowing cadets to gain practical knowledge and first-hand exposure to life and operations at sea.
news.content: Shipboard Familiarization for NAESS Cadets aboard MV Kapitan Felix Oca: Providing hands-on learning experience, allowing cadets to gain practical knowledge and first-hand exposure to life and operations at sea. Under the guidance of experienced crew members, from navigating ship systems to understanding key operational protocols. This experience serves as a crucial stepping stone in shaping the next generation of maritime professionals, ensuring they are well-equipped with the skills, knowledge, and practical insights needed to thrive in the dynamic and demanding world of maritime operations. ⚓️💙
news.author: Cadets

news.title: Shaping the future of skilled crews
news.summary: NAESS, in partnership with COMPASS Training Center, Inc., hosted a rigorous assessment for fitters.
news.content: NAESS, in partnership with COMPASS Training Center, Inc., hosted a rigorous assessment for fitters. Alongside C/E Todor Mihaylov - KOTC FPG Superintendent and C/E Panayot Panayotov - KOTC FEG Superintendent Participants showcased their expertise in lathe machining, gas cutting, gas brazing, and SMAW 2G & 3G welding. This initiative is part of our strategies and commitment in meeting the high demand of the industry in this rank. Moreover, NSPI is exceptionally engaged in building a highly competent pool of fitters, ready to meet industry demands with precision and efficiency.
news.author: Maritime team

news.title: Management Review
news.summary: A Comprehensive Look Back at Our Journey of Excellence and Progress.
news.content: As we reflect on our achievements and challenges, we remain focused on identifying new opportunities for growth and enhancing our operations. By embracing innovation, prioritizing sustainability, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement, we are committed to delivering exceptional maritime solutions. Our management team is dedicated to driving forward with integrity, ensuring not only the success of our company but also the strengthening of our relationships with clients, and partners, for a prosperous future.
news.author: Business Development Team

news.title: Team Building
news.summary: An evening of networking with industry peers, featuring refreshments and a panel discussion.
news.content: An evening of networking with industry peers, featuring refreshments and a panel discussion. This relaxed event provides a perfect opportunity to connect with other professionals in your field, share experiences, and discover potential collaboration opportunities. The panel discussion will explore current industry trends and future predictions, with plenty of time for audience questions and discussion. Attendance is limited to ensure quality interactions, so early registration is recommended.

news.title: Anti-Piracy Awareness Training
news.summary: Empowering another batch of NAESS Crew with Anti-Piracy Awareness Training
news.content: Empowering another batch of NAESS Crew with Anti-Piracy Awareness Training, a government-mandated course to ensure safety and preparedness of our crew at sea.
news.author: HR Management

announcements.title: Annual Maritime Conference 2025
announcements.description: Join us for the Annual Maritime Conference happening on May 10, 2025. Early bird registration now open for all industry professionals.

announcements.title: Service Expansion to Southeast Asia
announcements.description: We're proud to announce our service expansion to cover major ports across Southeast Asia, starting next month.

clients.name: Kuwait Oil Tanker Company
clients.description: The Company is mainly involved in the ownership and management of tankers engaged in the transport of crude oil, refined petroleum products and liquefied petroleum gases (LPG). In addition, it also operates a Marine Agency Branch, acting as sole agent of all tankers calling at Kuwait's sea port and a Gas Branch for the filling and distribution of LPG cylinders for local industry and domestic consumption. As the transportation arm of KPC it operates, on a commercial basis, a modern balanced fleet of Very Large Crude Carriers (VLCCs), petroleum product tankers and LPG carriers to maintain a strategic coverage of KPC's oil exports to all corners of the globe. In spite of the general slackness conditions in the tankers industry all over the world during the current years, KOTC managed to keep its profitability above the regular average due to its intensive concern for reducing the operating expenses and its wise policy of replacing old ships at the appropriate times.

clients.name: Reefership Marine Services Ltd
clients.description: The exclusive maritime transportation provider for Dole Fresh Fruit Co., and Dole Ocean Cargo Express, the commercial cargo subsidiary of Dole. Although incorporated in 1999 as Reefership Marine Services Ltd, the technical management staff of RMS have been responsible for Dole's fleet since 1986. Dole's fleet of vessels consist of conventional refrigerated pallet and refrigerated container vessels, the largest such dedicated refrigerated containerized fleet in the world.

clients.name: Sloman Neptun Schiffahrts AG
clients.description: Over 135 years of shipping experience, where professionals stand ready to solve all your transportation needs. Twenty-two modern tankers serve the global gas- and product oil markets, while four multipurpose vessels connect North Africa and other Mediterranean ports with Northern Europe through a scheduled liner service.

clients.name: Associated Marine Officers and Seamen's Union of the Philippines
clients.description: This company is a prominent union for Filipino seafarers, dedicated to safeguarding their rights and improving their working conditions. Established in the mid-20th century, the union champions the welfare of its members by offering a broad range of services, including legal support, health care, comprehensive training, and career development programs. Its mission extends beyond workplace advocacy to include robust community and family support initiatives, ensuring that both seafarers and their loved ones receive essential benefits and protections.

testimonials.name: John Doe
testimonials.text: Joining this company was one of the best decisions of my career. The collaborative environment and growth opportunities are unmatched!

testimonials.name: Jane Doe
testimonials.text: I've never worked anywhere that values creativity and innovation as much as this company. Every day brings new challenges and opportunities to learn.

testimonials.name: John Weck
testimonials.text: The supportive culture here has helped me develop both professionally and personally. I feel valued and empowered to contribute my best work.

faqs.question: What is the hiring process like?
faqs.answer: Our hiring process typically involves an initial screening call, followed by a technical or role-specific assessment, and then 2-3 interviews with team members and leadership. The entire process usually takes 2-3 weeks.

faqs.question: Do you offer relocation assistance?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer relocation packages for certain roles. The specifics depend on the position and location, but our HR team will discuss details with qualified candidates.

faqs.question: Can I work remotely?
faqs.answer: Many of our positions offer remote work options. Each job posting specifies whether the role is remote, hybrid, or on-site. We're committed to flexible work arrangements where possible.

faqs.question: What growth opportunities are available?
faqs.answer: We believe in promoting from within and offer clear career progression paths. We provide regular feedback, mentorship programs, and learning budgets to support your professional development.

faqs.question: How often do you hire new team members?
faqs.answer: We're constantly growing and hire year-round as needs arise. Even if you don't see a perfect match for your skills right now, we encourage you to submit your resume for future opportunities.
